snippet: As insurers embrace big data, your premiums may go up or down based not only on your driving record, but also your voting record and credit score.
abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column; car insurance premiums may go up or down based not only on driving records, but also factors like voting records and credit scores; Consumer Federation of America and New York Public Interest Research Group have released separate reports that say factors insurance companies are using to determine rates are detrimental to consumers, especially to low-income customers.
lead_paragraph: As insurers embrace big data, your premiums may go up or down based not only on your driving record, but also your voting record and credit score.

headline.main: As Data About Drivers Proliferates, Auto Insurers Look to Adjust Rates
headline.print_headline: As Data About Drivers Proliferates, Auto Insurers Look to Adjust Rates

keywords.value: New York Public Interest Research Group
keywords.name: organizations
